Token.Abstract:
NSRRemoteObject is the primary class in NSRails - any classes that subclass it will be treated with a "remote correspondance" and ActiveResource-like APIs will be available.
Note that you do not have to define an id property for your Objective-C class, as your subclass will inherit NSRRemoteObject's remoteID property.
# CoreData
The corresponding local property for remote attribute id.
The corresponding local property for remote attribute id.
The most recent dictionary of all properties returned by Rails, exactly as it returned it. (read-only)
The most recent dictionary of all properties returned by Rails, exactly as it returned it. (read-only)
If true, will remotely destroy this object if sent nested.
If true, will remotely destroy this object if sent nested.
Returns an array of all remote objects (as instances of receiver's class.) Each instance’s properties will be set to those returned by Rails.

Parameter.Name: error
Parameter.Abstract: Out parameter used if an error occurs while processing the request. May be NULL.

ReturnValue.Abstract: NSArray of instances of receiver's class. Each object’s properties will be set to those returned by Rails.

Token.Abstract: Returns an array of all remote objects (as instances of receiver's class), constructed with a parent prefix. Each instance’s properties will be set to those returned by Rails.

Parameter.Name: parentObject
Parameter.Abstract: Remote object by which to request the collection from - establishes pattern for resources depending on nesting. Raises an exception if this object's remoteID is nil, as it is used to construct the route.

Parameter.Name: error
Parameter.Abstract: Out parameter used if an error occurs while processing the request. May be NULL.

ReturnValue.Abstract: NSArray of instances of receiver's class. Each object’s properties will be set to those returned by Rails.

Token.Abstract: Retrieves an array of all remote objects (as instances of receiver's class.) Each instance’s properties will be set to those returned by Rails.

Parameter.Name: completionBlock
Parameter.Abstract: Block to be executed when the request is complete.

Token.Abstract: Retrieves an array of all remote objects (as instances of receiver's class.) Each instance’s properties will be set to those returned by Rails.

Parameter.Name: parentObject
Parameter.Abstract: Remote object by which to request the collection from - establishes pattern for resources depending on nesting. Raises an exception if this object's remoteID is nil, as it is used to construct the route.

Parameter.Name: completionBlock
Parameter.Abstract: Block to be executed when the request is complete.

Token.Abstract: Returns an instance of receiver's class corresponding to the remote object with that ID.

Parameter.Name: objectID
Parameter.Abstract: The ID of the remote object.

Parameter.Name: error
Parameter.Abstract: Out parameter used if an error occurs while processing the request. May be NULL.

ReturnValue.Abstract: Instance of receiver's class with properties from the remote object with that ID.

Token.Abstract: Retrieves an instance receiver's class corresponding to the remote object with that ID.

Parameter.Name: objectID
Parameter.Abstract: The ID of the remote object.

Parameter.Name: completionBlock
Parameter.Abstract: Block to be executed when the request is complete.

Token.Abstract: Retrieves the latest remote data for receiver and sets its properties to received response.

Parameter.Name: error
Parameter.Abstract: Out parameter used if an error occurs while processing the request. May be NULL.

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if fetch was successful. Returns NO if an error occurred.

Token.Abstract: Retrieves the latest remote data for receiver and sets its properties to received response.

Parameter.Name: completionBlock
Parameter.Abstract: Block to be executed when the request is complete.

Token.Abstract: Updates receiver's corresponding remote object.

Parameter.Name: error
Parameter.Abstract: Out parameter used if an error occurs while processing the request. May be NULL.

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if update was successful. Returns NO if an error occurred.

Token.Abstract: Updates receiver's corresponding remote object.

Parameter.Name: completionBlock
Parameter.Abstract: Block to be executed when the request is complete.

Token.Abstract: Creates the receiver remotely. Receiver's properties will be set to those given by Rails (including remoteID).

Parameter.Name: error
Parameter.Abstract: Out parameter used if an error occurs while processing the request. May be NULL.

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if create was successful. Returns NO if an error occurred.

Token.Abstract: Creates the receiver remotely. Receiver's properties will be set to those given by Rails (including remoteID).

Parameter.Name: completionBlock
Parameter.Abstract: Block to be executed when the request is complete.

Token.Abstract: Destroys receiver's corresponding remote object. Local object will be unaffected.

Parameter.Name: error
Parameter.Abstract: Out parameter used if an error occurs while processing the request. May be NULL.

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if destroy was successful. Returns NO if an error occurred.

Token.Abstract: Destroys receiver's corresponding remote object. Local object will be unaffected.

Parameter.Name: completionBlock
Parameter.Abstract: Block to be executed when the request is complete.

Token.Abstract: "Places" receiver's corresponding remote object.

Parameter.Name: error
Parameter.Abstract: Out parameter used if an error occurs while processing the request. May be NULL.

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if place was successful. Returns NO if an error occurred.

Token.Abstract: "Places" receiver's corresponding remote object.

Parameter.Name: completionBlock
Parameter.Abstract: Block to be executed when the request is complete.

Token.Abstract:
Serializes the receiver's properties into a dictionary.
Uses the coding methods.

Parameter.Name: wrapped
Parameter.Abstract:
If YES, wraps the dictionary with a key of the model name:
{"user"=>{"name"=>"x", "email"=>"y"}}

ReturnValue.Abstract: The receiver's properties as a dictionary.

Token.Abstract: Sets the receiver's properties given a dictionary.

Parameter.Name: dictionary
Parameter.Abstract: Dictionary to be evaluated.

Token.Abstract: Initializes a new instance of the receiver's class with a given dictionary input.

Parameter.Name: remoteDictionary
Parameter.Abstract:
Remote dictionary to be evaluated. (e.g., keys are "id", not "remoteID"; "my_property", not "myProperty").
Note that this dictionary needs to be JSON-parasable, meaning all keys are strings and all objects are instances of NSString, NSNumber, NSArray, NSDictionary, or NSNull.

ReturnValue.Abstract: A new instance of the receiver's class with properties set using dictionary.

Token.Abstract: The equivalent name of this class on your server.
The name of this class's controller on the server - where actions for this class should be routed.
Should be overridden if instances of your subclass class should have their resource path be based off an association.

Parameter.Name: request
Parameter.Abstract: The request whose path is currently being evalutated. Its route will be the route before adding the prefix (ie, the route used if the behavior is not desired).

ReturnValue.Abstract: An object (typically an instance variable) that represents a parent to this class, or nil if this behavior is not desired.

Token.Abstract: Should return the remote representation for each property, optionally modifying the remote key.

Parameter.Name: property
Parameter.Abstract: Name of the property.

Parameter.Name: remoteKey
Parameter.Abstract: Reference to an NSString that contains the key that should be put into the JSON going out. Will contain the key that would be sent by default (ie, underscored, if enabled.

ReturnValue.Abstract: Remote representation for this property. Return value must be JSON-parsable (NSDictionary, NSArray, NSString, NSNumber, or (NSNull or nil)).

Token.Abstract: Should set what you want an Objective-C property to be set to, based off a remote representation.

Parameter.Name: remoteObject
Parameter.Abstract: Remote representation of this key. Will be a JSON-parsed object (NSDictionary, NSArray, NSString, NSNumber, or nil).

Parameter.Name: remoteKey
Parameter.Abstract: The remote key returned from Rails. Use propertyForRemoteKey: if you want the Objective-C property version of this key.

Token.Abstract: Should return whether or not a certain property should be sent in the outgoing dictionary.

Parameter.Name: property
Parameter.Abstract: The name of the property.

Parameter.Name: nested
Parameter.Abstract: Whether or not the receiving object is being nested.

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the property should be included in the dictionary, NO if it shouldn't.

Token.Abstract: Should return the class for the nested object stored in the property, or nil if it is not a nested object.

Parameter.Name: property
Parameter.Abstract: Name of the property.

ReturnValue.Abstract: The class for the nested object stored in the property, or nil if it is not a nested object.

Token.Abstract: Should return whether or not a nested object should be sent with its entire body (xattributes), or just ID (xid).

Parameter.Name: property
Parameter.Abstract: Name of the property.

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if only the xid key should be sent for this nested property, NO if the full xattributes should be sent.

Token.Abstract: Should return the equivalent Objective-C property for a given remote key.

Parameter.Name: remoteKey
Parameter.Abstract: The key sent in the remote dictionary.

ReturnValue.Abstract: The Objective-C property equivalent for a remote key. If your class doesn't define a property for this remote key, this should return nil.

Token.Abstract: Should return a configuration for this class and its members.

ReturnValue.Abstract: A configuration for this class and its members.

Token.Abstract: Should return an array of all properties to be used by NSRails.

ReturnValue.Abstract: An array of all properties to be used by NSRails.

Token.Abstract: Should return whether or not this property should be encoded/decoded to/from a Date object.

Parameter.Name: property
Parameter.Abstract: Name of the property.

ReturnValue.Abstract: Whether or not this property should be encoded/decoded to/from a Date object.
